curated_text: Symbol: V. Year: 2023. Period: Q3. ReportType: Q10. Section: Competition and Market Position. This section discusses competitors, market dynamics, and regulatory landscape.  Competitors mentioned: Visa, Division, Foreign Currency Exchange Rate Litigation, European Commission Client Incentive Agreements Investigation, the European Commission, EC, Consumer Interchange Litigation, Mastercard, Management’s Discussion and Analysis of Financial Condition, Visa Inc., the U.S. Private Securities Litigation Reform Act, COVID-19, SEC, Contents Overview Visa, VisaNet, Diluted, European Union, Europe Retrospective Responsibility, Legal Matters, Interlink, U.S. International Visa Inc., International Visa Inc., TM, • Interest, Capital Resources Cash Flow Data, the Financial Accounting Standards Board, FASB, Accounting Standards Update, ASU, Company, Issuer Purchases, Shares Purchased, Mine Safety Disclosures, Financial, the Interactive Data File, the Securities Exchange Act, VISA INC. Context excerpt: competition with other payment methods and networks. Visa is cooperating with the Division in connection with the investigation. Foreign Currency Exchange Rate Litigation On December 21, 2022, plaintiffs filed a third amended complaint asserting the same claims as asserted in the prior complaints. European Commission Client Incentive Agreements Investigation On December 2, 2022, the European Commission (EC) informed Visa that it had opened a preliminary investigation into Visa’s incentive agreements with clients. Visa is cooperating with the EC in connection with the investigation. Consumer Interchange Litigation On December 30, 2022, a putative class action was filed in California state court against Visa, Mastercard, and certain financial institutions on behalf of all Visa and Mastercard cardholders in California who made a purchase using a Visa-branded or Mastercard-branded payment card in California from January 1, 2004.
